question: Next! What have you got? Five shillings for the possessed toy. Take it away. Next! What have you got?
answer: Well, I've got a talking donkey.

question: Right. Well, that's good for ten shillings, if you can prove it.
answer: Oh, go ahead, little fella.

question: Well?
answer: Oh, oh, he's just...he's just a little nervous. He's really quite a chatterbox. Talk, you boneheaded dolt...

question: That's it. I've heard enough. Guards!
answer: No, no, he talks! He does. I can talk. I love to talk. I'm the talkingest damn thing you ever saw.

question: Get her out of my sight.
answer: No, no! I swear! Oh! He can talk!

question: Oh, really? You and what army?
answer: Can I say something to you? Listen, you was really, really, really somethin' back here. Incredible!

question: Are you talkin' to... me? Whoa!
answer: Yes. I was talkin' to you. Can I tell you that you that you was great back here? Those guards! They thought they was all of that. Then you showed up, and bam! They was trippin' over themselves like babes in the woods. That really made me feel good to see that.

question: Oh, that's great. Really.
answer: Man, it's good to be free.

question: Now, why don't you go celebrate your freedom with your own friends? Hmm?
answer: But, uh, I don't have any friends. And I'm not goin' out there by myself. Hey, wait a minute! I got a great idea! I'll stick with you. You're mean, green, fightin' machine. Together we'll scare the spit out of anybody that crosses us. Oh, wow! That was really scary. If you don't mind me sayin', if that don't work, your breath certainly will get the job done, 'cause you definitely need some Tic Tacs or something, 'cause you breath stinks! You almost burned the hair outta my nose, just like the time... ...then I ate some rotten berries. I had strong gases leaking out of my butt that day.

question: Why are you following me?
answer: I'll tell you why. 'Cause I'm all alone, There's no one here beside me, My problems have all gone, There's no one to deride me, But you gotta have faith...

question: Stop singing! It's no wonder you don't have any friends.
answer: Wow. Only a true friend would be that cruelly honest.

question: Listen, little donkey. Take a look at me. What am I?
answer: Uh ...really tall?

question: No! I'm an ogre! You know. "Grab your torch and pitchforks." Doesn't that bother you?
answer: Nope.

question: Really?
answer: Really, really.

question: Oh.
answer: Man, I like you. What's you name?

question: Uh, Shrek.
answer: Shrek? Well, you know what I like about you, Shrek? You got that kind of I-don't-care-what-nobody-thinks-of-me thing. I like that. I respect that, Shrek. You all right. Whoa! Look at that. Who'd want to live in place like that?

question: That would be my home.
answer: Oh! And it is lovely! Just beautiful. You know you are quite a decorator. It's amazing what you've done with such a modest budget. I like that boulder. That is a nice boulder. I guess you don't entertain much, do you?

question: I like my privacy.
answer: You know, I do too. That's another thing we have in common. Like I hate it when you got somebody in your face. You've trying to give them a hint, and they won't leave. There's that awkward silence. Can I stay with you?

question: Uh, what?
answer: Can I stay with you, please?

question: Of course!
answer: Really?

question: No.
answer: Please! I don't wanna go back there! You don't know what it's like to be considered a freak. Well, maybe you do. But that's why we gotta stick together. You gotta let me stay! Please! Please!

question: Okay! Okay! But one night only.
answer: Ah! Thank you!

question: What are you...? No! No!
answer: This is gonna be fun! We can stay up late, swappin' manly stories, and in the mornin' I'm makin' waffles.

question: Oh!
answer: Where do, uh, I sleep?

question: Outside!
answer: Oh, well, I guess that's cool. I mean, I don't know you, and you don't know me, so I guess outside is best, you know. Here I go. Good night. I mean, I do like the outdoors. I'm a donkey. I was born outside. I'll just be sitting by myself outside, I guess, you know. By myself, outside. I'm all alone...there's no one here beside me...

question: I thought I told you to stay outside.
answer: I am outside.

question: Got ya. Ow! Enough! What are you doing in my house? Hey! Oh, no, no, no. Dead broad off the table. Huh? I live in a swamp. I put up signs. I'm a terrifying ogre! What do I have to do get a little privacy? Oh, no. No! No! What are you doing in my swamp? All right, get out of here. All of you, move it! Come on! Let's go! Hapaya! Hapaya! Hey! Quickly. Come on! No, no! No, no. Not there. Not there. Oh!
answer: Hey, don't look at me. I didn't invite them.

question: What? By who? All right. Who knows where this Farquaad guy is?
answer: Oh, I do. I know where he is.

question: Does anyone else know where to find him? Anyone at all?
answer: Me! Me!

question: Anyone?
answer: Oh! Oh, pick me! Oh, I know! I know! Me, me!

question: Okay, fine. Attention, all fairy tale things. Do not get comfortable. Your welcome is officially worn out. In fact, I'm gonna see this guy Farquaad right now and get you all off my land and back where you came from! Oh! You! You're comin' with me.
answer: All right, that's what I like to hear, man. Shrek and Donkey, two stalwart friends, off on a whirlwind big-city adventure. I love it! On the road again. Sing it with me, Shrek. I can't wait to get on the road again.

question: What did I say about singing?
answer: Can I whistle?

question: No.
answer: Can I hum it?

question: That's enough. He's ready to talk. Run, run, run, as fast as you can. You can't catch me. I'm the gingerbread man.
answer: You are a monster.

question: I'm not the monster here. You are. You and the rest of that fairy tale trash, poisoning my perfect world. Now, tell me! Where are the others?
answer: Eat me!

question: I've tried to be fair to you creatures. Now my patience has reached its end! Tell me or I'll...
answer: No, no, not the buttons. Not my gumdrop buttons.

question: All right then. Who's hiding them?
answer: Okay, I'll tell you. Do you know the muffin man?

question: The muffin man?
answer: The muffin man.

question: Yes, I know the muffin man, who lives on Drury Lane?
answer: Well, she's married to the muffin man.

question: The muffin man?
answer: The muffin man!

question: Then what are you waiting for? Bring it in.
answer: Ohhhh...

question: Magic mirror...
answer: Don't tell him anything! No!

question: Evening. Mirror, mirror on the wall. Is this not the most perfect kingdom of them all?
answer: Well, technically you're not a king.

question: Uh, Thelonius. You were saying?
answer: What I mean is you're not a king yet. But you can become one. All you have to do is marry a princess.

question: Go on.
answer: So, just sit back and relax, my lord, because it's time for you to meet today's eligible bachelorettes. And here they are! Bachelorette number one is a mentally abused shut-in from a kingdom far, far away. She likes sushi and hot tubbing anytime. Her hobbies include cooking and cleaning for her two evil sisters. Please welcome Cinderella. Bachelorette number two is a cape-wearing girl from the land of fancy. Although she lives with seven other men, she's not easy. Just kiss her dead, frozen lips and find out what a live wire she is. Come on. Give it up for Snow White! And last, but certainly not last, bachelorette number three is a fiery redhead from a dragon-guarded castle surrounded by hot boiling lava! But don't let that cool you off. She's a loaded pistol who likes pina colads and getting caught in the rain. Yours for the rescuing, Princess Fiona! So will it be bachelorette number one, bachelorette number two or bachelorette number three?

question: Three? One? Three? Okay, okay, uh, number three!
answer: Lord Farquaad, you've chosen Princess Fiona.

question: Princess Fiona. She's perfect. All I have to do is just find someone who can go...
answer: But I probably should mention the little thing that happens at night.

question: I'll do it.
answer: Yes, but after sunset...

question: But that's it. That's it right there. That's DuLoc. I told ya I'd find it.
answer: So, that must be Lord Farquaad's castle.

question: Uh-huh. That's the place.
answer: Do you think maybe he's compensating for something?

question: Hey, wait. Wait up, Shrek.
answer: Hey, you! Wait a second. Look, I'm not gonna eat you. I just - - I just - - It's quiet. Too quiet. Where is everybody?

question: Hey, look at this! Wow! Let's do that again!
answer: No. No. No, no, no! No.

question: No, I have a better idea. People of DuLoc, I give you our champion!
answer: What?

question: Congratulations, ogre. You're won the honor of embarking on a great and noble quest.
answer: Quest? I'm already in a quest, a quest to get my swamp back.

question: Your swamp?
answer: Yeah, my swamp! Where you dumped those fairy tale creatures!

question: Indeed. All right, ogre. I'll make you a deal. Go on this quest for me, and I'll give you your swamp back.
answer: Exactly the way it was?

question: Down to the last slime-covered toadstool.
answer: And the squatters?

question: As good as gone.
answer: What kind of quest?

question: What kind of quest?
answer: Let me get this straight. You're gonna go fight a dragon and rescue a princess just so Farquaad will give you back a swamp which you only don't have because he filled it full of freaks in the first place. Is that about right?

question: You know, maybe there's a good reason donkeys shouldn't talk.
answer: I don't get it. Why don't you just pull some of that ogre stuff on him? Throttle him, lay siege to his fortress, grinds his bones to make your bread, the whole ogre trip.

question: Oh, I know what. Maybe I could have decapitated an entire village and put their heads on a pike, gotten a knife, cut open their spleen and drink their fluids. Does that sound good to you?
answer: Uh, no, not really, no.

question: For your information, there's a lot more to ogres than people think.
answer: Example?

question: Example? Okay, um, ogres are like onions.
answer: They stink?

question: Yes - - No!
answer: They make you cry?

question: No!
answer: You leave them in the sun, they get all brown, start sproutin' little white hairs.

question: No! Layers! Onions have layers. Ogres have layers! Onions have layers. You get it? We both have layers.
answer: Oh, you both have layers. Oh. {Sniffs} You know, not everybody likes onions. Cake! Everybody loves cakes! Cakes have layers.

question: I don't care... what everyone likes. Ogres are not like cakes.
answer: You know what else everybody likes? Parfaits. Have you ever met a person, you say, "Let's get some parfait," they say, "Hell no, I don't like no parfait"? Parfaits are delicious.

question: No! You dense, irritating, miniature beast of burden! Ogres are like onions! And of story. Bye-bye. See ya later.
answer: Parfaits may be the most delicious thing on the whole damn planet.

question: You know, I think I preferred your humming.
answer: Do you have a tissue or something? I'm making a mess. Just the word parfait make me start slobbering. Ohh! Shrek! Did you do that? You gotta warn somebody before you just crack one off. My mouth was open and everything.

question: Believe me, Donkey, if it was me, you'd be dead. It's brimstone. We must be getting close.
answer: Yeah, right, brimstone. Don't be talking about it's the brimstone. I know what I smell. It wasn't no brimstone. It didn't come off no stone neither.

question: Sure, it's big enough, but look at the location.
answer: Uh, Shrek? Uh, remember when you said ogres have layers?

question: Oh, aye.
answer: Well, I have a bit of a confession to make. Donkeys don't have layers. We wear our fear right out there on our sleeves.

question: Wait a second. Donkeys don't have sleeves.
answer: You know what I mean.

question: You can't tell me you're afraid of heights.
answer: No, I'm just a little uncomfortable about being on a rickety bridge over a boiling like of lava!

question: Come on, Donkey. I'm right here beside ya, okay? For emotional support., we'll just tackle this thing together one little baby step at a time.
answer: Really?

question: Really, really.
answer: Okay, that makes me feel so much better.

question: Just keep moving. And don't look down.
answer: Okay, don't look down. Don't look down. Don't look down. Keep on moving. Don't look down. Shrek! I'm lookin' down! Oh, God, I can't do this! Just let me off, please!

question: But you're already halfway.
answer: But I know that half is safe!

question: Okay, fine. I don't have time for this. You go back.
answer: Shrek, no! Wait!

question: Just, Donkey - - Let's have a dance then, shall me?
answer: Don't do that!

question: Oh, I'm sorry. Do what? Oh, this?
answer: Yes, that!

question: Yes? Yes, do it. Okay.
answer: No, Shrek! No! Stop it!

question: You said do it! I'm doin' it.
answer: I'm gonna die. I'm gonna die. Shrek, I'm gonna die. Oh!

question: That'll do, Donkey. That'll do.
answer: Cool. So where is this fire-breathing pain-in-the-neck anyway?

question: Inside, waiting for us to rescue her.
answer: I was talkin' about the dragon, Shrek. You afraid?

question: No.
answer: But...

question: Shh.
answer: Oh, good. Me neither. 'Cause there's nothin' wrong with bein' afraid. Fear's a sensible response to an unfamiliar situation. Unfamiliar dangerous situation, I might add. With a dragon that breathes fire and eats knights and breathes fire, it sure doesn't mean you're a coward if you're a little scared. I sure as heck ain't no coward. I know that.

question: Donkey, two things, okay? Shut ... up. Now go over there and see if you can find any stairs.
answer: Stairs? I thought we was lookin' for the princess.

question: The princess will be up the stairs in the highest room in the tallest tower.
answer: What makes you think she'll be there?

question: I read it in a book once.
answer: Cool. You handle the dragon. I'll handle the stairs. I'll find those stairs. I'll whip their butt too. Those stairs won't know which way they're goin'. I'm gonna take drastic steps. Kick it to the curb. Don't mess with me. I'm the stair master. I've mastered the stairs. I wish I had a step right here. I'd step all over it.

question: Well, at least we know where the princess is, but where's the...
answer: Dragon!

question: Donkey, look out! Got ya!
answer: Oh! Aah! Aah! No. Oh, no, No! Oh, what large teeth you have. I mean white, sparkling teeth. I know you probably hear this all time from your food, but you must bleach, 'cause that is one dazzling smile you got there. Do I detect a hint of minty freshness? And you know what else? You're - - You're a girl dragon! Oh, sure! I mean, of course you're a girl dragon. You're just reeking of feminine beauty. What's the matter with you? You got something in your eye? Ohh. Oh. Oh. Man, I'd really love to stay, but you know, I'm, uh... I'm an asthmatic, and I don't know if it'd work out if you're gonna blow smoke rings. Shrek! No! Shrek! Shrek! Shrek!

question: Oh! Oh!
answer: Wake up!

question: What?
answer: Are you Princess Fiona?

question: I am, awaiting a knight so bold as to rescue me.
answer: Oh, that's nice. Now let's go!

question: But wait, Sir Knight. This be-ith our first meeting. Should it not be a wonderful, romantic moment?
answer: Yeah, sorry, lady. There's no time.

question: Hey, wait. What are you doing? You should sweep me off my feet out yonder window and down a rope onto your valiant steed.
answer: You've had a lot of time to plan this, haven't you?

question: Mm-hmm. But we have to savor this moment! You could recite an epic poem for me. A ballad? A sonnet! A limerick? Or something!
answer: I don't think so.

question: Can I at least know the name of my champion?
answer: Uh, Shrek.

question: Sir Shrek. I pray that you take this favor as a token of my gratitude.
answer: Thanks!

question: You didn't slay the dragon?
answer: It's on my to-do list. Now come on!

question: But this isn't right! You were meant to charge in, sword drawn, banner flying. That's what all the other knights did.
answer: Yeah, right before they burst into flame.

question: That's not the point. Oh! Wait. Where are you going? The exit's over there.
answer: Well, I have to save my ass.

question: What kind of knight are you?
answer: One of a kind.

question: The battle is won. You may remove your helmet, good Sir Knight.
answer: Uh, no.

question: Why not?
answer: I have helmet hair.

question: Please. I would'st look upon the face of my rescuer.
answer: No, no, you wouldn't - - 'st.

question: But how will you kiss me?
answer: What? That wasn't in the job description.

question: Maybe it's a perk.
answer: No, it's destiny. Oh, you must know how it goes. A princess locked in a tower and beset by a dragon is rescued by a brave knight, and then they share true love's first kiss.

question: Hmm? With Shrek? You think- - Wait. Wait. You think that Shrek is you true love?
answer: Well, yes.

question: You think Shrek is your true love!
answer: What is so funny?

question: What is so funny?
answer: Let's just say I'm not your type, okay?Fiona Look. I really don't think this is a good idea.

question: Just take off the helmet.
answer: I'm not going to.

question: Take it off.
answer: No!

question: Now!
answer: Okay! Easy. As you command. Your Highness.

question: You- - You're a- - an ogre.
answer: Oh, you were expecting Prince Charming.

question: Well, yes, actually. Oh, no. This is all wrong. You're not supposed to be an ogre.
answer: Princess, I was sent to rescue you by Lord Farquaad, okay? He is the one who wants to marry you.

question: Then why didn't he come rescue me?
answer: Good question. You should ask him that when we get there.

question: You're not making my job any easier.
answer: I'm sorry, but your job is not my problem. You can tell Lord Farquaad that if he wants to rescue me properly, I'll be waiting for him right here.

question: Hey! I'm no one's messenger boy, all right? I'm a delivery boy.
answer: You wouldn't dare. Put me down!

question: I'm right behind ya.
answer: Put me down, or you will suffer the consequences! This is not dignified! Put me down!

question: Okay, so here's another question. Say there's a woman that digs you, right, but you don't really like her that way. How do you let her down real easy so her feelings aren't hurt, but you don't get burned to a crisp and eaten?
answer: You just tell her she's not your true love. Everyone knows what happens when you find your... Hey! The sooner we get to DuLoc the better.

question: You're gonna love it there, Princess. It's beautiful!
answer: And what of my groom-to-be? Lord Farquaad? What's he like?

question: Shrek, What are you doing?
answer: I just- - You know - - Oh, come on. I was just kidding. And, uh, that one, that's Throwback, the only ogre to ever spit over three wheat fields.

question: Right. Yeah. Hey, can you tell my future from these stars?
answer: The stars don't tell the future, Donkey. They tell stories. Look, there's Bloodnut, the Flatulent. You can guess what he's famous for.

question: I know you're making this up.
answer: No, look. There he is, and there's the group of hunters running away from his stench.

question: That ain't nothin' but a bunch of little dots.
answer: You know, Donkey, sometimes things are more than they appear. Hmm? Forget it.

question: Hey, Shrek, what we gonna do when we get our swamp anyway?
answer: Our swamp?

question: You know, when we're through rescuing the princess.
answer: We? Donkey, there's no "we". There's no "our". There's just me and my swamp. The first thing I'm gonna do is build a ten-foot wall around my land.

question: You cut me deep, Shrek. You cut me real deep just now. You know what I think? I think this whole wall thing is just a way to keep somebody out.
answer: No, do ya think?

question: Are you hidin' something?
answer: Never mind, Donkey.

question: Oh, this is another one of those onion things, isn't it?
answer: No, this is one of those drop-it and leave-it alone things.

question: Why don't you want to talk about it?
answer: Why do you want to talk about it?

question: Why are you blocking?
answer: I'm not blocking.

question: Oh, yes, you are.
answer: Donkey, I'm warning you.

question: Who you trying to keep out?
answer: Everyone! Okay?

question: Oh, now we're gettin' somewhere.
answer: Oh! For the love of Pete!

question: What's your problem? What you got against the whole world anyway?
answer: Look, I'm not the one with the problem, okay? It's the world that seems to have a problem with me. People take one look at me and go. "Aah! Help! Run! A big, stupid, ugly ogre!" They judge me before they even know me. That's why I'm better off alone.

question: You know what? When we met, I didn't think you was just a big, stupid, ugly ogre.
answer: Yeah, I know.

question: So, uh, are there any donkeys up there?
answer: Well, there's, um, Gabby, the Small and Annoying.

question: Okay, okay, I see it now. The big shiny one, right there. That one there?
answer: That's the moon.

question: Mmm, yeah, you know I like it like that. Come on, baby. I said I like it.
answer: Donkey, wake up.

question: Huh? What?
answer: Wake up.

question: Oh! Of course! Oh, how rude. Please let me introduce myself. Oh, Merry Men.
answer: Ta, dah, dah, dah, whoo.

question: I steal from the rich and give to the needy.
answer: He takes a wee percentage,

question: But I'm not greedy. I rescue pretty damsels, man, I'm good.
answer: What a guy, Monsieur Hood.

question: Break it down. I like an honest fight and a saucy little maid...
answer: What he's basically saying is he likes to get...

question: Paid. So...When an ogre in the bush grabs a lady by the tush. That's bad.
answer: That's bad.

question: When a beauty's with a beast it makes me awfully mad.
answer: He's mad, he's really, really mad.

question: Man, that was annoying! Uh, shall we?
answer: Hold the phone. Oh! Whoa, whoa, whoa. Hold on now. Where did that come from?

question: What?
answer: That! Back there. That was amazing! Where did you learn that?

question: Well... when one lives alone, uh, one has to learn these things in case there's a... there's an arrow in your butt!
answer: What? Oh, would you look at that?

question: What are the flowers for?
answer: For getting rid of Donkey.

question: Ah.
answer: Now you hold still, and I'll yank this thing out.

question: Ow! Hey! Easy with the yankin'.
answer: I'm sorry, but it has to come out.

question: No, it's tender.
answer: Now, hold on.

question: What you're doing is the opposite of help.
answer: Don't move.

question: Look, time out.
answer: Would you... Okay. What do you propose we do?

question: Ow! Ohh!
answer: Ahem.

question: Nothing happend. We were just, uh - -
answer: Look, if you wanted to be alone, all you had to do was ask. Okay?

question: Oh, come on! That's the last thing on my mind. The princess here was just- - Ugh! Ow!
answer: Hey, what's that? That's...is that blood?

question: Mmm. This is good. This is really good. What is this?
answer: Uh, weed rat. Rotisserie style.

question: No kidding. Well, this is delicious.
answer: Well, they're also great in stews. Now, I don't mean to brag, but I make a mean weed rat stew.

question: I guess I'll be dining a little differently tomorrow night.
answer: Maybe you can come visit me in the swamp sometime. I'll cook all kind of stuff for you. Swamp toad soup, fish eye tartare - - you name it.

question: I'd like that.
answer: Um, Princess?

question: Yes, Shrek?
answer: I, um, I was wondering...are you... Are you gonna eat that?

question: Good night.
answer: Ohh! Now I really see what's goin' on here.

question: Oh, what are you talkin' about?
answer: I don't even wanna hear it. Look, I'm an animal, and I got instincts. And I know you two were diggin' on each other. I could feel it.

question: You're crazy. I'm just bringing her back to Farquaad.
answer: Oh, come on, Shrek. Wake up and smell the pheromones. Just go on in and tell her how you feel.

question: I- - There's nothing to tell. Besides, even if I did tell her that, well, you know - - and I'm not sayin' I do 'cause I don't - - she's a princess, and I'm
answer: An ogre?

question: Yeah. An ogre.
answer: Hey, where you goin'?

question: To get... move firewood.
answer: Princess? Princess Fiona? Princess, where are you? Princess? It's very spooky in here. I ain't playing no games. Aah!

question: Princess? Princess Fiona? Princess, where are you? Princess? It's very spooky in here. I ain't playing no games. Aah!
answer: Oh, no!

question: No, help!
answer: Shh!

question: Shrek! Shrek! Shrek!
answer: No, it's okay. It's okay.

question: What did you do with the princess?
answer: Donkey, I'm the princess.

question: Aah!
answer: It's me, in this body.

question: Oh, my God! You ate the princess. Can you hear me?
answer: Donkey!

question: Listen, keep breathing! I'll get you out of there!
answer: No!

question: Shrek! Shrek! Shrek!
answer: Shh.

question: Shrek!
answer: This is me.

question: Princess? What happened to you? You're, uh, uh, uh, different.
answer: I'm ugly, okay?

question: Well, yeah! Was it something you ate? 'Cause I told Shrek those rats was a bad idea. You are what you eat, I said. Now - -
answer: No. I - - I've been this way as long as I can remember.

question: What do you mean? Look, I ain't never seen you like this before.
answer: It only happens when sun goes down. "By night one way, by day another. This shall be the norm... until you find true love's first kiss... and then take love's true form."

question: Ah, that's beautiful. I didn't know you wrote poetry.
answer: It's a spell. When I was a little girl, a witch cast a spell on me. Every night I become this. This horrible, ugly beast! I was placed in a tower to await the day my true love would rescue me. That's why I have to marry Lord Farquaad tomorrow before the sun sets and he sees me like this.

question: All right, all right. Calm down. Look, it's not that bad. You're not that ugly. Well, I ain't gonna lie. You are ugly. But you only look like this at night. Shrek's ugly 24-7.
answer: But Donkey, I'm a princess, and this is not how a princess is meant to look.

question: Princess, how 'bout if you don't marry Farquaad?
answer: I have to. Only my true love's kiss can break the spell.

question: But, you know, um, you're kind of an orge, and Shrek - - well, you got a lot in common.
answer: Shrek?

question: I can't just marry whoever I want. Take a good look at me, Donkey. I mean, really, who can ever love a beast so hideous and ugly? "Princess" and "ugly" don't go together. That's why I can't stay here with Shrek. My only chance to live happily ever after is to marry my true love. Don't you see, Donkey? That's just how it has to be. It's the only way to break the spell.
answer: You at least gotta tell Shrek the truth.

question: No! You can't breathe a word. No one must ever know.
answer: What's the point of being able to talk if you gotta keep secrets?

question: Promise you won't tell. Promise!
answer: All right, all right. I won't tell him. But you should. I just know before this is over, I'm gonna need a whole lot of serious therapy. Look at my eye twitchin'.

question: I tell him, I tell him not. I tell him, I tell him not. I tell him. Shrek! Shrek, there's something I want... Shrek. Are you all right?
answer: Perfect! Never been better.

question: I - - I don't - - There's something I have to tell you.
answer: You don't have to tell me anything, Princess. I heard enough last night.

question: You heard what I said?
answer: Every word.

question: I thought you'd understand.
answer: Oh, I understand. Like you said, "Who could love a hideous, ugly beast?"

question: But I thought that wouldn't matter to you.
answer: Yeah? Well, it does. Ah, right on time. Princess, I've brought you a little something.

question: Very well, ogre. The deed to your swamp, cleared out, as agreed. Take it and go before I change my mind. Forgive me, Princess, for startling you, but you startled me, for I have never seen such a radiant beauty before. I'm Lord Farquaad.
answer: Lord Farquaad? Oh, no, no. Forgive me, my lord, for I was just saying a short... farewell.

question: Oh, that is so sweet. You don't have to waste good manners on the ogre. It's not like it has feelings.
answer: No, you're right. It doesn't.

question: Princess Fiona, beautiful, fair, flawless Fiona. I ask your hand in marriage. Will you be the perfect bride for the perfect groom?
answer: Lord Farquaad, I accept. Nothing would make - -

question: Excellent! I'll start the plans, for tomorrow we wed!
answer: No! I mean, uh, why wait? Let's get married today before the sun sets.

question: Oh, anxious, are you? You're right. The sooner, the better. There's so much to do! There's the caterer, the cake, the band, the guest list. Captain, round up some guests!
answer: Fare-thee-well, ogre.

question: Shrek, what are you doing? You're letting her get away.
answer: Yeah? So what?

question: Shrek, there's something about her you don't know. Look, I talked to her last night, She's - -
answer: I know you talked to her last night. You're great pals, aren't ya? Now, if you two are such good friends, why don't you follow her home?

question: Shrek, I - - I wanna go with you.
answer: I told you, didn't I? You're not coming home with me. I live alone! My swamp! Me! Nobody else! Understand? Nobody! Especially useless, pathetic, annoying, talking donkeys!

question: But I thought - -
answer: Yeah. You know what? You thought wrong!

question: Shrek.
answer: Donkey? What are you doing?

question: I would think, of all people, you would recognize a wall when you see one.
answer: Well, yeah. But the wall's supposed to go around my swamp, not through it.

question: It is around your half. See that's your half, and this is my half.
answer: Oh! Your half. Hmm.

question: Yes, my half. I helped rescue the princess. I did half the work. I get half the booty. Now hand me that big old rock, the one that looks like your head.
answer: Back off!

question: No, you back off.
answer: This is my swamp!

question: Our swamp.
answer: Let go, Donkey!

question: You let go.
answer: Stubborn jackass!

question: Smelly ogre.
answer: Fine!

question: Hey, hey, come back here. I'm not through with you yet.
answer: Well, I'm through with you.

question: Uh-uh. You know, with you it's always, "Me, me, me!" Well, guess what! Now it's my turn! So you just shut up and pay attention! You are mean to me. You insult me and you don't appreciate anything that I do! You're always pushing me around or pushing me away.
answer: Oh, yeah? Well, if I treated you so bad, how come you came back?

question: Because that's what friends do! They forgive each other!
answer: Oh, yeah. You're right, Donkey. I forgive you... for stabbin' me in the back!

question: Ohh! You're so wrapped up in layers, onion boy, you're afraid of your own feelings.
answer: Go away!

question: There you are , doing it again just like you did to Fiona. All she ever do was like you, maybe even love you.
answer: Love me? She said I was ugly, a hideous creature. I heard the two of you talking.

question: She wasn't talkin' about you. She was talkin' about, uh, somebody else.
answer: She wasn't talking about me? Well, then who was she talking about?

question: Uh-uh, no way. I ain't saying anything. You don't wanna listen to me. Right? Right?
answer: Donkey!

question: No!
answer: Okay, look. I'm sorry, all right? I'm sorry. I guess I am just a big, stupid, ugly ogre. Can you forgive me?

question: Hey, that's what friends are for, right?
answer: Right. Friends?

question: Friends.
answer: So, um, what did Fiona say about me?

question: What are you asking me for? Why don't you just go ask her?
answer: The wedding! We'll never make it in time.

question: Ha-ha-ha! Never fear, for where, there's a will, there's a way and I have a way.
answer: Donkey?

question: I guess it's just my animal magnetism.
answer: Aw, come here, you.

question: Go ahead, HAVE SOME FUN. If we need you, I'll whistle. How about that? Shrek, wait, wait! Wait a minute! You wanna do this right, don't you?
answer: What are you talking about?

question: There's a line you gotta wait for. The preacher's gonna say, "Speak now or forever hold your peace." That's when you say, "I object!"
answer: I don't have time for this!

question: Hey, wait. What are you doing? Listen to me! Look, you love this woman, don't you?
answer: Yes.

question: You wanna hold her?
answer: Yes.

question: Please her?
answer: Yes!

question: Then you got to, got to try a little tenderness. The chicks love that romantic crap!
answer: All right! Cut it out. When does this guy say the line?

question: The whole town's in there.
answer: I now pronounce you husband and wife...

question: They're at the altar.
answer: ...king and queen.

question: Hi, everyone. Havin' a good time, are ya? I love DuLoc, first of all. Very clean.
answer: What are you doing here?

question: Really, it's rude enough being alive when no one wants you, but showing up uninvited to a wedding... Fiona! I need to talk to you.
answer: Oh, now you wanna talk? It's a little late for that, so if you'll excuse me

question: But you can't marry him.
answer: And why not?

question: Uh, Fiona?
answer: Yes, Shrek?

question: I - - I love you.
answer: Really?

question: Really, really.
answer: I love you too.

question: Fiona? Fiona. Are you all right?
answer: Well, yes. But I don't understand. I'm supposed to be beautiful.
